title: Planner/Scheduler III
description:
**Must be a USC or GC holder**

**No 3rd party or vendors**

**Must work on a w2**

**Three days on site!**

SOFT's client, located in **Melville, NY** is looking for a Project Controls Scheduler for a long term contract assignment. The Project Controls Scheduler will develop and oversee the schedule management delivery of projects within Gas Complex Construction. Utilizing Primavera P6, the scheduler will develop, monitor, update, and apply project controls techniques to ensure scope, schedule, and budget adherence throughout the Network Development Process. This is a hybrid position, 3 days on-site per week.

Key Accountabilities:  
•Accountable for building and developing project schedules across a portfolio. The schedules will be built using the agreed work breakdown structure to support Engineers, Construction Managers, and Project Managers.  
•Progress each project every month to ensure all projects are monitored for project controls in line with the monthly reporting cycle, checking accuracy and consistency of data, as well as supporting the end of year reconciliation process.  
•Accountable for using the schedule and forecast to review the project cost/schedule integration throughout the Network Development Process.  
•Accountable for ensuring schedule data is accurate to allow Project Controls to report milestones, planned value and earned value data, % completed on projects and project commentaries.  
•Provide technical input and project level analysis.  
•Understand sound scheduling logic and the interface of milestones and links between activities, portfolio views, etc.

* Understand how individual projects interact with each other as a result of outage plans and project interdependencies.

•Support the activities of other team members, providing input and analysis as required.  
•The ability to support, communicate and effectively develop working relationships with staff at all levels.  
•Ability to use computer-based planning tools and work scheduling systems.

Qualifications:

* Bachelor’s degree in one of the following fields: Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Building Engineering, Bachelor of Architecture, or an equivalent of eight (8) years of verifiable work experience in a scheduling/technical role.

**At least 3 years of relevant experience in the use of Oracle** **Primavera Project Management (P6) for the purpose of developing, monitoring, and maintaining the EPC &** Integrated Schedule and all required reporting.  
•Sound knowledge and understanding of project scheduling.

* **Must have intermediate knowledge or advance knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills.**

**•Good communication and time management.**

* Demonstrated relevant experience in construction, planning, scheduling, expediting, and tracking the progress of the Work for contracts of a similar nature, size, and complexity.
* Valid driver’s license required with a safe driving history.

Areas of expertise should include but not limited to:

* Performed Schedule Delay Analysis throughout the life cycle of the Project.
* Utilizing Windows Schedule Delay Analysis Method

•Prepared project Change Order schedule delay estimates & analysis.

* Evaluated Extension of Time Requests (EOT)
* **Provided written updates on schedule variances for inclusion in both Monthly and Quarterly Reports.**

**• Developed and Integrated Schedule Frag-Net for Change Orders into Project Schedule**.

* Evaluated the impact of additional work order to the schedule.
* Provided written updates on critical paths for inclusion in both Monthly and Quarterly Reports.
* Reviewed and analyzed schedules developed by General Contractors.
* Reviewed contractor schedule logic, durations, and recovery plans.
* Conduct Construction Progress Verification for all work packages from various Construction Managers, Resident Engineers and Field Engineers via Site Walk-Throughs.

**• Perform Schedule & Cost Variances Analysis.**  
**• Critical Path Analysi**s.

* Prepared Monthly Schedule Analysis and Progress Reports For Assigned Projects.
* Understanding of Earned Value Management As Related To The Engineering & Construction Projects.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $50.00 - $60.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Primavera P6: 8 years (Required)
* Microsoft Excel: 8 years (Required)
* project cost/schedule: 8 years (Required)
* construction, planning, scheduling: 8 years (Required)
* Perform Schedule & Cost Variances Analysis.: 8 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

title: Planned Respite Service Provider l Staten Island l Richmond
company: The Collaborative for Children and Families
description:
**About us**

The Collaborative for Children and Families (CCF) is a coalition of more than 25 community-based member organizations. Our member organizations have decades of collective experience working with children and families and are deeply rooted within the communities we serve. CCF partners with Hospitals, Managed Care Organizations (MCOs) and community-based healthcare providers—serving all five boroughs in New York City, Westchester, Nassau and Suffolk counties.

CCF is a Health Home Serving Children and Families as well as a designated Children's Home and Community Based Services (HCBS) provider. We are designated by New York State Department of Health striving to keep children and families in NYS healthy!

Through CCFs network partnership we have created a seamless way to access providers that can conduct physicals, perform complex mental health assessments, and provide treatment to those who are Medicaid eligible. We work together to improve access to healthcare services for children and their families which will result in better health outcomes and an improved quality of life by providing best quality care coordination and community based services to achieve more efficient and better outcomes for all.

**Position Summary and Responsibilities:** The Planned Respite Service Provider, works under the direct supervision of the Community Based Services Provider Supervisor and provides community-based services that focus on short-term assistance provided to children/youth, regardless of disability, because of the absence of or need for relief of the child, or the child’s family caregiver. Respite workers supervise the child/youth and engage the child/youth in activities that support his/her and/or primary caregiver/family’s constructive interests and abilities. Respite Service Providers will offer services with a level of expertise in understanding and implementing behavioral/developmental interventions required to support optimal functioning for children/youth during planned care.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

* **Planned Respite (PR):**Provide short-term relief for the child or family/primary caregivers that are needed to enhance the family/primary caregiver’s ability to support the child/youth’s functional, developmental, behavioral health, and/or health care needs.

Planned Respite activities support the plan of care goals and include providing supervision and activities that match the child/youth’s developmental stage and continue to maintain the child/youth’s health and safety.

* Development and updating of Person Center service plans (initial plan within 30 days of first service and every 6 months thereafter) including obtaining medical consenter signatures at the initial session following the approval of such documentation.
* Obtaining consents and enrollment documents for newly enrolled children/youth at initial session and scanning documents into the Electronic Health Record.
* Attend monthly waiver service provider meetings and individual supervision to stay current on practices and protocols.
* Submit progress notes, service plans, and service provider logs within set forth-required timeframes. It is the responsibility of the provider to maintain necessary technology (phone, internet, timely computer access, and video camera) to perform job requirement functions of documentation, coordinating, service planning and billing.
* Report incident(s) to supervisor upon discovery.
* Maintain open communication with other service providers (e.g., Care Manager, other service providers and Supervisory Team) to report on child/youth’s progress, and identify any potential barriers and referrals, and to support the overall health and wellbeing of the child and family.
* Check emails daily and respond to emails from Care Managers, Supervisors, and other team members within 24-48 hours.
* Setting of Service Provision:Planned Respite can be provided in the home of the youth or a community setting.

**Essential Skills, Experience, Licensure, Certification:**

**Qualifications**:

* Respite providers are minimally required to have a high school diploma or equivalent and with appropriate skills and training.
* Experience working with children/youth.

**Relationships with Others**

* Maintains a strength-based approach in working with children and families.
* Accepts and applies constructive feedback from supervisors to enhance the quality-of-service delivery.
* Be a team player.
* Have a strong sensitivity to cultural differences present among staff and members within our organization.
* Possess a strong belief in people’s ability to grow and change; forge a mutually respectful partnership with persons served and their families.
* Ability to set limits and maintain helping role of practitioner and to intervene appropriately.

**Working Conditions**

* Work is conducted in the community of the youth being serviced.

**Training Requirements**:

* Prior to Service Delivery: Mandated Reporter Training
* Within 6 months of hire:
* Personal Safety
* Safety in the Community
* Strength Based Approached
* Suicide Prevention
* Domestic Violence Signs and Basic Interventions
* Trauma Informed Care

The above job description is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of duties and standards of the position.

*CCF is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.*

Pay: $22.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Experience:

* Children: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Staten Island, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Outside Sales Building Supplies Rep
description:
Celtic Building Supplies, a business servicing construction companies, architects, contractors, engineers, and homebuilders in the tri-state area for over 20 years with all their building material, safety, and project needs, is seeking to hire an ***Outside Sales Representative (OSR)***.

At Celtic we are dedicated to providing **excellent service to our customers and to helping our staff make their career what they want it to be**.

***Family owned and operated, great culture, great benefits, and lots of room for growth! 60% of our employees have been with the company for 5 years or more.***

As an ***Outside Sales Rep*** you will be responsible for increasing sales and building relationships with customers in order to grow the footprint of the business and increase sales month over month. This includes generating business from prospective customers, making cold calls, sourcing customers through jobsite visits throughout the **tri-state area (NY, NJ and CT)**, and servicing business for existing customers in concert with the Inside Sales Rep. This is a ***full-time, salaried position with uncapped commission and ongoing bonuses.*** The starting salary range for this position is $45,000 - $65,000 per year.

**Core Responsibilities:**

* **85%-90% of the time will be focusing on generating business from prospective customers**
* 10%-15% of the time will focus on servicing existing customers in concert with the Inside Sales Rep (ISR)
* Network and develop relationships with developers, project managers, purchasers, and industry decision makers
* Actively participate in meetings, trade shows, and other industry events as needed
* Obtain continuous product knowledge
* Achieve all sales goals and metrics

**Required Skills and Competencies:**

* **Exceptional customer service is a must!**
* 3-5 years of aggressive inside or outside sales experience
* 1-3 years of Building Materials/ Building Supply or relevant experience preferred
* Knowledge of contractors, vendors, and competitors in the tristate area
* Handle high volume phone and email communication
* Basic knowledge of CRM software or previous experience with, and the use of organizational tools to manage book of business
* High-level technical skills: Microsoft Outlook, Mail, Calendar, Word and Excel
* Strong problem-solving skills
* Organized with an extraordinary attention to detail
* Dependable, reliable, and trustworthy
* Energetic, outgoing, and patient
* Ability to work both independently and in a team environment
* Ability to prioritize tasks, recognize the high sense of urgency, and to meet all deadlines
* Ability to professionally communicate, in English, across various departments with all levels of employees both verbally and in writing
* Ability to act independently and make decisions autonomously in accordance with Company Policy and Procedure

**Reports To:**

* Outside & Inside Sales Supervisor

**Why Build With Celtic?**  
**Responsive and Reliable**  
Celtic Building Supplies has over 20 years of frontline experience delivering quality building materials to every corner of NYC and the tri-state area. Whether you’re an architect, contractor, engineer, homebuilder or just passionate about DIY a warm welcome awaits you at The Celtic Store – A place where personal service, trust, and product expertise comes as standard. We sell everything for commercial and residential construction.

***Customer Service Is Essential To Our Success!***  
We perpetually strive to provide our customers with a combination of value added services coupled with superior products at competitive prices. Every member of our team is empowered to maximize the customer’s service experience on every transaction.***That is the Celtic Service Guarantee.***  
***When Service Matters, Build With Celtic!***

description:

title: Part-Time Outreach Coordinator (Spanish-Speaking)
company: Korean Community Services of Metropolitan New York, Inc. (KCS)
description:
**ORGANIZATION:** Korean Community Services of Metropolitan New York, Inc. (KCS)

**POSITION TITLE:** Part-Time Outreach Coordinator (Spanish-Speaking)

**DEPARTMENT:** Public Health and Research Center (PHRC)

**REPORTS TO:** Director/Program Manager

**APPLICATION PROCESS:**

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the position is filled. To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your qualifications and interest in the position to Sara Kim, Director of PHRC, and Louis Kang, Assistant Director of PHRC.

**Contact Information:**

● **Sara Kim, Director of PHRC** | Email: Skim@kcsny.org

● **Louis Kang, Assistant Director of PHRC** | Email: LouisK@kcsny.org

**About KCS:**

Korean Community Services of Metropolitan New York, Inc. (KCS) was established in 1973 to provide comprehensive social services to the Korean and broader immigrant populations across the greater New York area. As a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization, KCS is supported by government agencies, foundations, corporations, and individual donors. Our mission is to deliver a wide array of professional services spanning immigration, education, aging, workforce development, public health, and mental health, tailored to meet the diverse needs of our community.

**Position Summary:**

KCS is seeking a part-time Outreach Coordinator fluent in Spanish to support the BRAVE and NYCCare programs. This individual will play a crucial role in conducting community outreach, client support, and program coordination within the Long Island City (LIC) area and Manhattan/Chinatown. This role requires up to 20 hours per week, with a starting hourly rate of $18.

**Key Responsibilities:**

● **Community Outreach:** Engage with community members through in-person and occasional virtual events to increase awareness and participation in KCS programs, including BRAVE and NYCCare. Extend outreach efforts to connect clients with additional services such as food security, workforce development, and other public health resources. Distribute culturally relevant outreach materials in target areas, including West Queens (LIC/Sunnyside) and Manhattan (Chinatown/Koreatown).

● **Client Support:** Conduct thorough client intakes and pre-screenings for NYCCare. Ensure seamless linkage to primary care providers by coordinating appointments and guiding clients through the enrollment process, whether in private or public healthcare programs. Provide ongoing support to help clients navigate complex healthcare systems.

**Translation & Interpretation:** Deliver Spanish language interpretation and translation services during interactions with external agencies, community members, and internal staff. Assist with ● translating materials for KCS navigators and other team members to ensure clear and effective communication.

● **Data Management:** Accurately record and maintain detailed logs of outreach activities and client interactions. Prepare and submit regular reports to supervisors, leveraging data insights to enhance program effectiveness and inform strategic decision-making.

● **Program Coordination:** Collaborate closely with the BRAVE and NYCCare teams to ensure the smooth execution of program initiatives and client services. Actively participate in monthly check-ins and Office Hour meetings hosted by Health and Hospitals (H+H). Additionally, contribute to the planning and execution of tabling events, health fairs, and other outreach activities, particularly within key outreach locations in LIC and Manhattan.

**General Responsibilities:**

● **Monthly Engagement:** Attend monthly Office Hour meetings and check-ins with Health and Hospital (H&H).

● **Client Services:** Conduct intakes and pre-screenings for NYC Care, scheduling appointments to link clients with primary care providers.

● **Outreach Participation:** Actively engage in outreach events, including weekend and health fairs, primarily in LIC, Queens, and Lower East Side, Manhattan.

● **Information Dissemination:** Share NYC Care information with potential clients.

● **Ongoing Communication:** Regularly update the Program Manager on NYC Care enrollment activities.

**Qualifications:**

● **Language Proficiency:** Bilingual in English and Spanish (written and spoken required).

● **Experience:** At least one year of experience in community outreach, client services, or a related field. Experience working within healthcare or social service settings is preferred.

● **Education:** Associate’s degree in health/social services, social work, human services, or a related field is preferred.

● **Skills:** Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Highly organized, detail-oriented, and capable of multitasking. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and virtual platforms.

● **Cultural Competence:** Ability to work effectively with diverse populations and understand culturally sensitive practices.

● **Travel Requirements:** Must be able to travel throughout NYC, particularly within LIC and Manhattan/Chinatown, for outreach and client services.

● Physical Requirements: Must be able to lift up to 20lbs and to stand for extended periods during off-site activities

**Working Hours, Compensation & Benefits:**

● **Hours:** Up to 20 hours per week, primarily within normal working hours (9 AM – 5 PM, Monday – Friday). Availability for some evening and weekend events as required.

● **Salary:** $18 per hour / paid bi-weekly

● **Benefits:** This part-time position is not eligible for benefits but offers a valuable opportunity to contribute to a mission-driven organization and gain experience in community outreach and public health.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $18.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Weekends as needed

Experience:

* Teaching: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Bayside, NY 11361 (Preferred)

title: Echo Tech
description:
Join our dynamic team as an **Echo Tech/ Medical Assistant** with a Cardiac background, where your expertise will play a crucial role in patient care.

Apply now to be part of our committed team.

**Who we are**

We are a medical testing facility that specializes in comprehensive cardiovascular and pulmonary medical evaluations for first responders throughout New Jersey. Our practice was built out of the Captain Buscio Program, a foundation created by Donna Buscio after her husband, Captain Dominick Buscio of the Jersey City Fire Department, unexpectedly passed away at 39 from a heart attack.  
Our cardiovascular and pulmonary tests help current and retired members of the police force, state troopers, firefighters, and EMTs to be aware of their cardiovascular health and help to identify any health concerns. Employers do not mandate our tests and the results do not affect our patients' employment. Currently, We have six different locations across New Jersey and hope to open more soon.

**What we do**

We administer tests to evaluate heart and lung functionality. We offer seven different tests for our patients over a five-hour appointment time slot. Our patients can come back two weeks after their appointment to review their results with our board-certified medical professionals.

**What we are looking for**

You will be responsible for providing administrative support to ensure the efficient operation of the medical office/hospital. You will support doctors and patients through various tasks related to patient care management, organization, and communication. As an employee will have access to **medical, vision, and dental insurance as well as PTO.**

**Responsibilities:**

· Collect patient vitals and medical history.

· Update medical records in the electronic medical records.

· Communicating with patients

· Arrange hospital admissions and laboratory services.

· Submitting patient tests to labs to be professionally reviewed.

· Assist during medical examinations.

· Handle receivable and payable accounts and keep financial records.

· Ensure that the medical facilities are sanitized before and after every patient.

· Administer cardio-pulmonary tests on patients.

· Setting up and maintaining ultrasound equipment

· Performing ultrasound examinations on patients

· Producing images resulting from the ultrasound examinations

· Interpreting ultrasound images to aid patient diagnosis

· Additional clinical duties as needed.

**Required**:

· Medical Assistant Degree

· Registered Sonography license

· ARDMS Certification

· Certified Clinical Medical Assistant (CCMA) (Preferred)

· Microsoft and Google Office Suite: 1 year (Preferred)

· EMR systems: 2 years (Preferred)

· Phlebotomy: 1 year (Preferred)

· Medical Terminology: 1 year (Preferred)

· Spanish Speaking is a plus

· Medical records experience plus

title: Preschool Before and After School Teacher
description:
Futures start here. Where first steps, new friendships, and confident learners are born. At KinderCare Learning Companies, the first and only early childhood education provider recognized with the **Gallup Exceptional Workplace Award**, we offer a variety of early education and child care options for families. We pave the way for their lifelong learning journey ahead. And we want you to join us in shaping a future we can all be proud to share—in neighborhoods, at work, and in schools nationwide.

Our teachers, center staff, and field leaders are the heart and soul of our business. When you join us, you’ll be directly supporting children and their education every day and experiencing the trials and triumphs that come with that responsibility. But you’ll never be alone. You’ll do it all with a village of dedicated and passionate humans who care as much about helping kids reach their highest potential as you do. The best part? Seeing the positive impact you’re making on the lives of young learners and their families—and knowing that your work matters.

When you join our team as a Teacher we will:

* Invest in you and your career at KinderCare as you create a world-class experience in our classrooms
* Reward your commitment to our children and families as your journey continues with us
* Implement KinderCare's curriculum in a way that is consistent with the unique needs of each child
* Create a safe, nurturing environment where children can play and learn
* Partner and connect with parents, with a shared desire to provide the best care and education for their children
* Support your center’s success; partner with center staff and leadership to achieve goals around enrollment, accreditation, and engagement
* Cultivate positive relationships with families, teachers, state licensing authorities, community contacts and corporate partners

Qualifications - External

* Outstanding customer service skills, strong organizational skills, and the ability to multi-task and handle multiple situations effectively
* Meet state specific qualifications for the role or willingness to obtain
* CPR and First Aid Certification or willingness to obtain
* Physically able to lift a minimum of 40 pounds, and work indoors or outdoors
* Able to assume postures in low levels to allow physical and visual contact with children, see and hear well enough to keep children safe, and engage in physical activity with children
* Read, write, understand, and speak English to communicate with children and their parents in English

**Our benefits meet you where you are.** We’re here to help our employees navigate the integration of work and life:

* Know your whole family is supported with **discounted child care benefits.**
* Breathe easy with **medical, dental, and vision benefits** for your family (and pets, too!).
* Feel supported in your mental health and personal growth with **employee assistance programs.**
* Feel great and thrive with access to **health and wellness programs, paid time off** and **discounts** for work necessities, such as cell phones.
* … and much more.

We operate research-backed, accredited, and customizable programs in more than 2,000 sites and centers across 40 states and the District of Columbia. As we expand, we’re matching the needs of more and more families, dynamic work environments, and diverse communities from coast to coast. Because we believe every family deserves access to high-quality child care, no matter who they are or where they live. Every day, you’ll help bring this mission to life by building community and delivering exceptional experiences. And if you’re anything like us, you’ll come for the work, and stay for the people.

KinderCare Learning Companies is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, age, sex, religion, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, military or veteran status, gender identity or expression, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal law.

title: Cell Production Technician
description:
**About ATL**

Being your best is not what we expect but what you should expect of yourself. Come be part of our team. We’re here to help you along your journey to succeed.

Aero Tec Laboratories was founded in 1970 as a design and testing facility for "flexible composite" materials. Shortly thereafter, the firm broadened its scope to include the actual fabrication of end products from its own outstanding fiber/elastomer composites. These end products are used in many industries, including motorsport, automotive, marine, defense, aviation, and aerospace!

Over its generation of growth, ATL USA has assembled an enviable legion of agents and distributors, plus a sister company in England, ATL UK.

**Job Description:**

* Having passed probation period: required to have learned the fundamentals of bladder manufacturing with continual improvement in finish quality of product.
* Manufacturing of a less complex or standard bladders manufactured from standard materials to the required quality with some assistance.
* Display good time management skills by maintaining schedule throughout the production of bladders with only some assistance.
* Help the Production Manager by completing general duties.
* Liaise with the Level 1 Cell Production Technicians to gain on-the-job training in all manufacturing processes to continually improve skills and efficiency levels and to be able to progress to more difficult cells and levels.

title: Administrative Director- Enhanced Family Foster Care
company: Seamen's Society for Children and Families
description:
**The Organization:**

Founded in 1846 to care for the children and widows of sailors in the Port of New York, Seamen's Society was one of the first organizations, in the US, to care for abandoned children in family settings, rather than institutions. Today, Seamen's Society for Children and Families is a comprehensive $23 million nonprofit organization that offers foster care and adoption services, mental and behavioral health care services, prevention/family stabilization services, a child care center program, domestic violence intervention and counseling services, health home care management services, education financial support, and a youth tutoring program. The agency's nearly 210 professionals serve over 1,100 children and 800 families in New York City.

**Job Summary**:

The Administrative Director of EFFC is responsible for the overall management of the program’s Permanency (Adoption/KinGap and FTC), Homefinding, and Youth Services departments. As key member of the program and agency’s leadership team the Administrative Director will ensure a culture of accountability and transparency while carrying the shared goal of creating meaningful differences for the children and families served. The Administrative Director will develop and implement strategies for staff recruitment, retention, and career development. Working alongside the Director of Enhanced Family Foster Care, the Administrative Director will co-lead the program and help drive the mission of Seamen’s Society.

**Duties and Responsibilities**:

* Provides ongoing supervision to a team that includes the Director of Homefinding, Manager, Youth Services, and Manager, Permanency
* Ensures the coordination, integration and ongoing communication between the Case Planning department and the departments assigned
* Utilizes the monthly performance reports as well as the results of internal and external practice audits to actively lead continuous quality improvement efforts
* Actively monitors reunification and permanency planning activities through the promotion of concrete, actionable strategies
* Ensures a proactive approach to Adoption and KinGap performance monitoring by addressing all potential barriers to finalization
* Monitors all Family Team Conference activities, leads improvement planning efforts as appropriate and ensures the time approval of FASPs
* Supports the Director of Homefinding ensuring that the department is meeting its admissions, training, licensing, support and recruitment targets
* Ensures cross-department integration by participating in Case Planning specific meetings including Incident Reviews, QA/QI Performance Monitoring, and Case Reviews
* Supports the Youth Services department ensuring the education, vocational and other coaching/fair future-based goals for the youth are achieved
* Oversees the monitoring of APPLA cases including CCS21+ and transitional Medicaid
* Serves as the organization’s NEICE (ICPC) liaison
* Practices and models a high degree of professionalism, ensuring responsiveness and accountability at the individual, departmental and program level
* Participates in the agency’s DEI committee, and Department Head meetings
* Ensures the prioritization of staff development through ongoing training activities, transparent routine staff evaluations and a commitment to supervision
* Represents Seamen’s Society at the state and city level for Foster Care, and department related meetings
* Ensures the delivery of high performing services through the integration of casework practices, social work and data driven management practices
* Ensures the development and implementation of all programmatic policies, procedures, and related business processes in accordance with existing and newly developed practices

**Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities:**

* Commitment to building an accountable, transparent, and equitable departmental culture
* Strong leadership and management skills with a demonstrated ability to lead change across organizational units and to manage with a collaborative, responsive, team-building approach
* Expertise in supervision, administration, program development, and process development
* Proficiency in data analysis and Quality Improvement practices.
* Successful track record in designing and implementing new programs.
* Team player with exceptional planning, organizational and follow up skills.
* Effective communication, interpersonal and writing skills.
* Ability to perform the essential functions of the job with or without a reasonable accommodation.

**Qualifications/Requirements:**

* MSW or related graduate degree with 5 years of progressive supervisory experience in the child welfare field required. LCSW/LMSW preferred.
* Valid Driver’s License preferred.
* Our Agency operates in 2 locations: Staten Island and Brooklyn. The ability to travel between sites in required.
* Performs other duties/responsibilities as assigned within the scope of position.

**Additional Information**  
Seamen’s Society is committed to providing an inclusive and welcoming environment for all members of our staff, participants, volunteers, subcontractors, and vendors. We respect diversity and accordingly are an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, alienage, citizenship status, age, disability, sex, gender, gender identity or expression (sexual orientation, marital status, partnership status, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

title: EMPOWERMENT COACH - Foster Care (Hybrid)
company: Seamen's Society for Children and Families
description:
**Job Summary**:

The Seamen’s Society Academic Support Program provides a holistic approach to working with middle school and high school students in Foster Care. Aligned with the 7 Core Principles of the Fair Futures Initiative our program seeks to surround our youth with individualized and catered attention and support. The department aims to put youth on stable path by focusing on their success in middle school, high school, college and career development. The program remains with a youth through age 21, or until they are on a living wage career path.

Empowerment Coaches will work solely with High School students in our Foster Care program. The Coaches will build trusting relationships and provide social and emotional support to the youth. The coach will be there for the youth, help them navigate any challenges, celebrate successes and plan for the future.

**Duties and Responsibilities**:

* Work one-on-one with each young person on their coach load to create individual goals. Uses MST Adaptive and Motivational Interviewing techniques to develop and follow action plans to reach these goals, with consistent support, communication, and follow-through.
* Use goal setting tools to develop customized action plans for each youth to help them reach their goals.
* Establish strong relationships with adolescents using effective modeling of pro-social skills.
* Work collaboratively with other system providers in the youth’s life including to help ensure that the varied systems are driving towards similar goals in a coordinated fashion.
* Meet regularly with parents/foster parents/adult supports to plan with them for youth success, and to support them in helping the youth in their care, reach their goals.
* Encourage youth to attend therapeutic peer groups which focus on skills such as healthy communication, positive peer relationships, dealing with peer pressure, and service learning.
* Works closely with the Educational Specialist/Coordinator to help students apply for college.
* Works closely with the PYA Coordinator to help students secure employment and thrive in the workplace.
* Works closely with the Housing Specialist to help the youth secure after care housing solutions.
* Visit schools to meet with guidance counselors or other school officials. This includes gathering report cards and attending parent/teacher conferences.
* Connect youth to resources, schools, programs and opportunities in line with their goals.
* Help students select vocational programs or colleges based on academic, social, and financial needs.
* All other related duties as assigned.

**Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities:**

* Makes a long-term commitment to working with youth.
* Computer literate and conversant with social media.
* Is strengths-focused, and open to learning new methods of working with youth and willing to hold him/herself to high practice standards.
* Can work with diverse populations (including LGBTQ) and cultures, process information and respond empathically.
* Can express empathy and genuine caring, while maintaining healthy boundaries.
* Ability to perform the essential functions of the job with or without a reasonable accommodation.

**Qualifications/Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s Degree with 2 years of working with at risk populations or an Associate’s degree with 4 years of working with at risk populations.
* Our Agency operates in 2 locations, Staten Island and Brooklyn. The ability to travel between sites may be necessary.
* Due to the nature of the work environment work hours will be based on needs of program and may vary including evenings.

**Additional Information**

Seamen’s Society is committed to providing an inclusive and welcoming environment for all members of our staff, participants, volunteers, subcontractors, and vendors. title: Billing & Accounts Receivable Coordinator
description:
Grant Herrmann Schwartz & Klinger LLP (www.ghsklaw.com) has an opportunity for a highly skilled and motivated Billing/AR Assistant to join the law firm. We are seeking a motivated professional to execute day-to-day billing and accounts receivable activities. If you are ready to make a significant impact and thrive in a fast-paced legal environment, we invite you to be part of our team.

**ESTIMATED PAY RANGE:** 

$22-25/hour

**POSITION SUMMARY:**

The Billing & Accounts Receivable Assistant plays a crucial role in supporting the billing processes at our Firm and coordinating accounts receivable activities. This role collaborates closely with billing staff, legal staff, and clients to ensure timely and accurate invoices are created and sent, resolve billing discrepancies, and monitor and collect outstanding balances. This position requires strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and effective communication.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

**Billing**

Provide support in generating accurate and timely invoices for legal services rendered.

Ensure invoices comply with client billing guidelines and legal regulations.

*Sample additional processes:*

o Verify all time and costs have been entered in the system

o Pull prebills & disseminate these to the respective Billing Party (partner/responsible)

o Edit and post bills timely

o Email bills to respective Billing party

o Report completion of Billing Cycle

o Unpost bills

o Address and resolve any billing discrepancies or inquiries from clients.

o Work closely with attorneys to ensure accurate representation of billable activities.

o Formatting bills

o Maintaining rate sheets

o Processing write-offs

***Accounts Receivable:***

Monitor and manage accounts receivable, tracking payments and outstanding balances.

Follow up on overdue payments and work to resolve payment issues, including reaching out directly to clients via phone and email.

*Sample additional processes:*

o Cash Receipts backup

o Post Cash Receipts on a daily basis & keep organized electronic records

o Check deposits

o Incoming wires

o Credit Card Payments

o Cash payments

o Accounts Receivable Aging

* Customizing reporting in Excel per partner
* Disseminate via Email to all Partners and copy Controller

***General***

Generate regular reports related to billing and accounts receivable.

Maintain organized and up-to-date records in the firm's systems.

Communicate effectively with others, for example with clients regarding billing inquiries, overdue payments, and updates.

Respond to billing inquires by reviewing bills, last bill paid, outstanding invoices, unbilled time, entries/expenses, etc.

Track accounts receivables and coordinate collection efforts with Partner or Associate in charge of delinquent accounts; coordinate collection efforts with Partner, Associate, or assistant, and/or Finance.

Follow GAAP in all processes and record keeping as well as follow NY/FL State Bar Accounting Procedures for Trust Accounting.

Provide assistance with special projects, as needed.

**REQUIRED AND PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:**

* **Preferred Education:** Bachelor’s degree
* **Preferred Experience:** 1-3 years of recent and related law firm billing experience

**WORKPLACE LOCATION REQUIREMENTS**

* Requires in-office work at the NYC office daily.

**COMPETENCIES:**

* **Ownership Mindset**: Is dependable and reliable and brings their best each day and to every task. Takes personal accountability for ensuring work gets done. Proactively addresses issues/open items without needing to be prompted by others; acts quickly to achieve results; sees tasks through to the end. Seeks to assist in areas outside of standard scope of responsibility.
* **Quality of work & attention to detail:** Delivers error-free work that fulfills the requirements of the assignment; assumes they are the last person that will review a document or email prior to sending; takes pride in their deliverables and ensures careless mistakes are not made.
* **Organization & Productivity:** Efficiently uses time; plans and prioritizes work effectively; works in an organized fashion; completes assignments in a timely manner and meets deadlines.
* **Ethics and Compliance:** Followsthe standards of Professional and Ethical Conduct at all times and conducts themselves with honesty and integrity in all interactions (both internal and external).
* **Management of Expectations (both internal colleagues/attorneys and external clients):** Makes clients – both internally and externally - the top priority while effectively managing expectations; listens carefully to needs and recommends appropriate services in response; keeps others informed and follows up to ensure satisfaction.
* **Positivity, Optimism, Adaptability, Flexibility:** Maintains a positive outlook; faces challenges with optimism; sees the possibilities in all situations. Contributes constructively by providing helpful, relevant ideas, even if the situation is challenging. Adapts to changing needs, conditions, and work responsibilities; and maintaining composure in stressful situations; open to different and new ways of doing things; willing to modify approach.
* **Interpersonal Skills:** Building constructive working relationships characterized by a high level of cooperation and mutual respect; communicating respectfully and listening to others while making an attempt to understand alternative viewpoints.
* **Communication Skills:** Demonstrates mastery of both written and verbal communications, delivering clear and organized thoughts. Is responsive to internal and external clients, providing timely and accurate responses that take the needs of the recipient into account.
* **Technology:** Excellent computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite, strong information management skills, and the ability to learn new programs and skills as needed.

The firm offers a competitive salary commensurate with experience, along with great benefits such as 401k, medical, dental, and vision.

description:

title: Hitch Installer ($20/hr to start)
description:
**Hitch Installer ($20/hr to start)**
-------------------------------------


Do you enjoy working with your hands? Are you interested in learning valuable technical skills? U-Haul is seeking a hard-working, knowledgeable person for the position of Hitch Service Technician. Hitch Service Technicians work in U-Haul Moving and Storage Center lots to provide outstanding service to customers using their advanced technical expertise.


Our motto is “**Hire Fast, Pay Fast**." You can start today and get paid today! Schedule a hands-on working interview and get paid for it. We also offer a **$100 Hiring Bonus!**

**U-Haul Offers Hitch Service Technicians:**

* Career stability
* Opportunities for advancement
* Mindset App Reimbursement
* Gym Reimbursement Program
* Health insurance & Prescription plans, if eligible
* Paid holidays, vacation, and sick days, if eligible
* Life insurance
* MetLaw Legal program
* MetLife auto and home insurance
* Discounts on Apple products, Dell computers, cell phone plans, hotels, and more
* 401(k) Savings Plan
* Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP)
* 24-hour physician available for kids
* Dental & Vision Plans
* Business travel insurance
* You Matter Program (EAP) Employee Assistance Program
* LifeLock Identity Theft Protection
* Critical Illness/Group Accident Insurance
* Dave Ramsey’s SmartDollar Program

 **Hitch Service Technician Primary Responsibilities:**

* Understand and explain U-Haul’s variety of towing packages
* Recommend and install the right tow package on customer vehicles
* Provide exceptional customer service and support to U-Haul customers.
* Other duties as assigned
* Participate in ongoing continuous U-Haul education through U-Haul University

**Requirements:**

* Valid driver’s license and the ability to maintain a good driving record
* Basic wiring and hand/power tool experience
* High School Diploma or equivalent

**Work Environment:**


The work involves moderate risks or discomforts which require special safety precautions, e.g., working around moving parts, machines, fumes, or irritating chemicals. May be required to use protective clothing, or gear such as masks, goggles, gloves, or shields.

**Physical Demands:**


The work requires some physical exertion such as long periods both indoors and outdoors of remaining stationery, traversing spaces, repositioning to reach and use tools, and moving a minimum of 50 lbs. assisted or unassisted.


Pay Range is: $16.40 - $22.35 Hourly  

  

  

U-Haul is an equal opportunity employer. All applications for employment will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, provincial, state, or local law. Individual accommodations are available on requests for applicants taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Information obtained during this process will only be shared on a need to know basis.


  
### **About Us**


Since 1945, U-Haul has been serving do-it-yourself movers and their households. Like many other successful ventures, the concept for U-Haul was generated out of need. After World War II, there existed the widespread need for do-it-yourself moving equipment that would be available on a one-way, nationwide basis.


U-Haul co-founders L.S. "Sam" Shoen and his wife, Anna Mary Carty Shoen, recognized that need and acted upon it. Their visionary approach spread the cost of ownership among many users, facilitating the mobility of the populations of the U.S. and Canada. The covered wagon of the pioneers morphed into orange U-Haul trailers. In the process, an industry was born.


U-Haul Holding Company and its family of companies, including U-Haul, have strived to create a culture of health and wellness. As of February 1, 2020, and consistent with applicable law, no U-Haul Holding Company or its family of companies will hire individuals in states where it may lawfully decline to hire individuals who use nicotine products (Alabama, Alaska, Arizona, Arkansas, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Hawaii, Idaho, Iowa, Kansas, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Nebraska, Pennsylvania, Texas, Utah, Vermont, Virginia and Washington). This policy will not apply to team members hired before February 1, 2020.
company_description: Get your career moving with the world’s largest do-it-yourself moving and self-storage company. Based in Phoenix, AZ, U-Haul has locations in all 50 states and 13 Canadian Provinces and Territories.

* Dave Ramsey’s SmartDollar Program
* U-Haul Federal Credit Union membership

**Assistant General Manager Responsibilities:**

* Run daily operations of center in General Manager’s absence.
* Make moment-to-moment decisions to allocate time and resources to appropriate. projects
* Manage and assign your team members to ensure that customers receive an excellent first impression and the highest quality of care.
* Miscellaneous duties such as installing hitches, brake controllers, etc.
* Participate in ongoing continuous U-Haul education through U-Haul University.

**Minimum Requirements:**

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Driver’s license and ability to maintain a clean driving record
* Leadership experience in any form
* Customer service experience
* Ability to work a variety of shifts

**Work Environment:**  

The work involves moderate risks or discomforts which require special safety precautions, e.g. working around moving parts, machines, fumes or irritant chemicals. May be required to use protective clothing or gear such as masks, goggles, gloves or shields.

**Physical Demands:**  

The work requires some physical exertion, such as, long periods both indoors and outdoors while remaining stationary, traversing spaces, repositioning to reach and use tools, and moving a minimum of 50 lbs. assisted or unassisted.


Pay Range is: $16.50 - $25.30 Hourly  

  

  

U-Haul is an equal opportunity employer. All applications for employment will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, provincial, state, or local law. Individual accommodations are available on requests for applicants taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Information obtained during this process will only be shared on a need to know basis.


  
### **About Us**


Since 1945, U-Haul has been serving do-it-yourself movers and their households. Like many other successful ventures, the concept for U-Haul was generated out of need. After World War II, there existed the widespread need for do-it-yourself moving equipment that would be available on a one-way, nationwide basis.


U-Haul co-founders L.S. "Sam" Shoen and his wife, Anna Mary Carty Shoen, recognized that need and acted upon it. Their visionary approach spread the cost of ownership among many users, facilitating the mobility of the populations of the U.S. and Canada. The covered wagon of the pioneers morphed into orange U-Haul trailers. In the process, an industry was born.


U-Haul Holding Company and its family of companies, including U-Haul, have strived to create a culture of health and wellness. As of February 1, 2020, and consistent with applicable law, no U-Haul Holding Company or its family of companies will hire individuals in states where it may lawfully decline to hire individuals who use nicotine products (Alabama, Alaska, Arizona, Arkansas, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Hawaii, Idaho, Iowa, Kansas, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Nebraska, Pennsylvania, Texas, Utah, Vermont, Virginia and Washington). This policy will not apply to team members hired before February 1, 2020.

title: Personal Injury Paralegal
description:
Thriving Plaintiff’s personal injury firm located in Midtown Manhattan seeks to expand our office support staff. The candidate for the position must be a dependable self-starter with a strong work ethic and organizational skills. We are looking for a true team player, someone who plays well with others, to become a permanent part of our successful team. This is a great opportunity to work with attorneys while performing various tasks throughout the litigation process on personal injury cases and room to advance your career.

**Primary Responsibilities:**

*Litigation Paralegal*

* Our Litigation Paralegal will draft Summons and Complaints and assure compliance with discovery demands and Court Orders relating to discovery; drafting of discovery documents - Bill of Particulars (with the ability to review and analyze medical records), Combined Discovery Responses, Notices of Discovery and Inspection, handle simple Motions (i.e., Default Judgment where defendant does not Answer), Respond to Demands for authorizations, etc.
* The qualified candidate must be familiar with the relevant laws in New York pertaining to personal injury claims, including No-Fault, SUM claims and be well-versed with Motor Vehicle, Slip & Fall, and Construction (Labor Law 240, 241) accident cases.

*Trial Preparation*

* Working with the attorneys, the Litigation Paralegal will help get the case file trial ready. Tasks include supplementing Bill of Particulars, expert exchanges, drafting and serving of subpoenas, preparing Notice of Intention to use diagnostic films, certifications of medical records, etc.
* Ideally, the Litigation Paralegal will work with attorneys during trial to line up witnesses, prepare jury instructions, jury selection exhibits and verdict sheets.

*Administrative*

* By constantly updating the information in the case file database, our Litigation Paralegal ensures that all the litigation is moving forward properly.
* Monitoring Summons and Complaints to ensure proper and timely service.
* Familiarity with filing OCA retainers and closing statements.
* The Litigation Paralegal will regularly communicate with our team, clients, adversaries, and the Courts.

**Qualifications:**

* 1-3 years of Plaintiff’s Personal Injury Litigation experience required
* Spanish speaking preferred, but not required.
* Computer savvy candidate(s) who are proficient with all Microsoft Office applications - Word, Excel, SharePoint, Teams, To Do.
* Must have experience and working knowledge of electronic filing requirements in State and Federal Courts, including ability to use E-Law and E-Courts (required); and PACER (optional).
* Must stay up to date with New York civil litigation - and specific IAS Part - Court rules, procedures, e-calendar technology.
* Ability to work both independently and as part of a team and prioritize numerous tasks and complete them under time constraints while maintaining a high level of attention to detail.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Plaintiff's Personal Injury Law: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Counselor
description:
**Comunilife Inc.** is looking for a Counselor for its **Respite program** in Manhattan. The Counselor is responsible for providing personal care services to patients who are in need of assistance with their activities of daily living and/or other support services. Duties include personal care, grooming, meal preparation, cooking accompanying to medical appointments, light housekeeping/cleaning, run errands and more. ***This position is eligible for Comunilife's generous benefits and paid time off package including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, retirement employer contributions after 2 years, tuition reimbursement and professional development opportunities.***

**Schedule:**

**Sun.-Thurs. 9am-5pm**

**Essential duties:**

* Assess clients’ substance abuse, health, mental health, and other care needs; recommend internal and external referrals;
* Provide individual and group counseling;
* Prepare psycho-socials;
* Facilitate psycho-education groups in relapse prevention, health literacy, and navigating mental health and substance abuse systems, etc. for residents their family and/or support networks;
* Provide Comprehensive Case Management services;
* Assist clients in improving and maintaining self-care, interpersonal, and vocational skills
* Assist clients in achieving housing stability
* Assist in the management of discharge planning; engage and support clients 90 days post discharge;
* Manage client documentation, provide program narrative and/or statistical reports as needed;
* Participate in ongoing QI and program evaluation activities
* Assists clients with activities of daily living, recreation/leisure and personal care
* Documents electronic information accurately and in a timely fashion
* Completes with daily household maintenance, housekeeping and special projects
* Ensures adequate supervision of consumers, including “if your shift replacement does not arrive, you are expected to remain on shift at your worksite until a suitable replacement staff has been located and arrives to replace you.”
* Works with and shows respect for employees, supervisors, vendors and clients
* Communicates effectively with others at work verbally and in writing, using the primary spoken language of clients in the home whenever possible
* Administers medications without errors (as requested)
* Reads and follows company policies and procedures
* Performs other duties as assigned
* Provide personal hygiene assistance for elderly patients or those recovering from surgeries, injuries or accidents by attending to their basic needs, such as showering, bathing, dressing and eating.
* Help clients take prescribed medication and assist clients with ambulation
* Help with mobility around the house or outside (doctor’s appointments, walks etc.)
* Assist with personal care and hygiene, plan and prepare meals and help with physical therapy exercises.
* Complete client’s shopping or accompany them to successfully do so
* Perform housekeeping duties and report any unusual incidents
* Act quickly and responsibly in cases of emergency
* Offer activities that are essential for daily living by assisting patients with their meals, including serving

**Education and Experience Requirement(s):**

* Bachelor's degree required
* CPR, First Aid and Crisis Prevention certification
* At least one-year experience providing home health aide services.
* Experience supporting individuals with disabilities, mental illnesses or challenging behaviors
* At least one-year experience with utilizing electronic medical record systems
* One year of relevant community-based residential or social service agency experience
* Knowledge of basic medical skills and tasks, relevant trainings presented by NYSDOH
* Knowledge of New York State Home Care Curriculum, laws, regulations, and codes
* Ability to access patients’ vitals and properly document readings
* Ability to work with integrity, demonstrative compassion and pay attention to detail
* Bilingual in Spanish preferred
* Ability to communicate effectively in verbal and written English
* Proficiency with office software Google and Microsoft Office Suites
* Works effectively as a team member with other members of department and agency leaders

description:

Our team is committed to enhancing our patients' skin health and overall well-being. We pride ourselves on our exceptional service and patient-centered approach.

The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills, a strong attention to detail, and a passion for providing outstanding patient care. As the first point of contact for our patients, you will play a crucial role in ensuring a positive experience at our practice.

* **Team Collaboration:** Work closely with medical and spa staff to ensure smooth operations and effective patient care.

* **Experience:** Previous experience as a receptionist or in a customer service role preferred. Experience in a medical or dermatology office is a plus.

* A supportive, relaxed, and friendly work environment

title: Logistics Coordinator
description:
**Job Title**: Logistics Coordinator

**Location**: Primarily Remote with Occasional Office Visits

**About Us**:

Packable is a 360-degree service provider dedicated to elevating brand success with an end-to-end suite of services including digital enablement, fulfillment, logistics, and value-driven solutions. We seamlessly integrate inventory management, B2B and DTC fulfillment, and streamline operations on major marketplaces like Amazon and Walmart. Our goal is to simplify and provide solutions to brands, enabling our partners to thrive in today's competitive marketplace. Packable’s culture is fast-paced, exciting, and entrepreneurial, making it an ideal environment for innovative thinkers and doers. We are seeking a hands-on and detail-oriented Logistics Coordinator to join our dynamic team.

**Job Summary**:

The Logistics Coordinator will be responsible for managing and optimizing logistics processes that support both eCommerce and B2B services for our clients. This role requires a blend of technical proficiency in logistics systems, hands-on interaction with warehouse and transportation teams, and strong organizational skills. The ideal candidate will be adept at coordinating transportation, supporting warehouse operations, collaborating on inventory management, and ensuring timely and accurate order fulfillment. This role also requires familiarity with routing guidelines and the ability to implement processes that ensure compliance with retailer-specific standards. This position offers the opportunity to work closely with multiple departments and grow within a fast-paced, client-focused environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Warehouse Operations:**

Actively participate in daily warehouse activities, including receiving, storing, and shipping goods. Work closely with warehouse staff to ensure the efficient use of space and resources, optimizing operations to meet client demands.

* **Transportation Management:**

Coordinate and monitor the transportation of goods, ensuring seamless delivery from suppliers to the warehouse and from the warehouse to customers. Select appropriate transportation methods based on cost, reliability, and client-specific requirements. Provide insights and data to support carrier negotiations.

* **Technical Skills & Systems Management****:**

Utilize Microsoft Excel to create, maintain, and analyze logistics and inventory reports. Work proficiently with the company’s Warehouse Management System (WMS) to manage inventory, process orders, and ensure accurate data entry. Navigate and manage various client transportation portals, ensuring compliance with client-specific requirements.

* **Routing Guidelines & Compliance****:**

Understand and apply routing guidelines to ensure all shipments meet retailer-specific standards. Develop and implement processes to ensure these guidelines are consistently followed throughout the logistics operation.

* **Client Coordination****:**

Serve as a point of contact for both eCommerce and B2B clients regarding shipping inquiries, order status, and delivery timelines. Collaborate with customer service and commercial teams to address client concerns and ensure high levels of satisfaction.

* **Compliance & Documentation****:**

Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations, including customs, import/export, and transportation laws. Prepare and maintain necessary documentation for shipments, including bills of lading, packing lists, and invoices.

* **Process Improvement****:**

Identify opportunities for process improvement within logistics and supply chain operations. Implement best practices to increase efficiency, reduce costs, and improve service levels.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s or Associate’s degree in related field, or equivalent work experience.

title: Behavior Technician
description:
Integrated Therapy is dedicated to providing specialized services for children with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD). We understand the unique challenges faced by both children and their families and are committed to creating supportive environments that foster growth, learning, and joy. Our comprehensive services are designed to address the individual needs of each child, promoting their development in a compassionate and nurturing way.

**Our Services:**  
At Integrated Therapy, we offer a wide range of therapies tailored to support children with ASD. Our in-home care services are designed to alleviate the stress on parents while ensuring that their children receive the highest quality care in the comfort of their own homes. By working closely with families, we strive to create safe, happy, and structured environments where children on the spectrum can thrive.

**Our Mission:**  
Our mission is to empower children with ASD by providing them with the tools and support they need to succeed. We aim to be a trusted partner for families, offering guidance, care, and expertise to help children reach their full potential. By alleviating the daily pressures on parents and caregivers, we enable them to focus on what matters most—the well-being and happiness of their children.

**Position Overview:**  
We are currently seeking a dedicated and compassionate Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) to join our dynamic team. The RBT will play a pivotal role in implementing individualized behavior intervention plans under the supervision of Board-Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs). This position offers an exciting opportunity to make a meaningful difference in the lives of our clients and their families while working within our private preschool settings.

**Responsibilities:**

* Implement behavior intervention plans designed by BCBAs to target skill acquisition and behavior reduction goals.
* Provide direct, one-on-one therapy sessions with clients in various settings, including our private preschools, homes, schools, and community settings.
* Collect and record data on client progress and behavior during therapy sessions.
* Collaborate effectively with the multidisciplinary team, including BCBAs, preschool teachers, parents, and other healthcare professionals.
* Maintain confidentiality and adhere to ethical guidelines outlined by the Behavior Analyst Certification Board (BACB).

**Qualifications:**

* Must hold a current certification as a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) issued by the Behavior Analyst Certification Board (BACB).
* High school diploma or equivalent required; bachelor's degree in psychology, education, or related field preferred.
* Previous experience working with individuals with developmental disabilities or behavioral challenges preferred.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Reliable transportation and willingness to travel to various client locations.

**Benefits:**

* Opportunities for career advancement and growth within the organization.
* Childcare discount

Join our team and become a part of our mission to empower individuals with developmental disabilities to reach their full potential. If you are passionate about making a positive impact and are dedicated to providing high-quality care, we encourage you to apply. This position may require some travel to different sites. This role can be full time or part time as needed

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $20.00 - $23.00 per hour

title: Contract Recruiter
description:
Located in Brooklyn, NY ( Hybrid ) looking for a Contract Recruiter for a long term contract assignment.

About us  
Our client is hiring a Talent Acquisition Specialist for our People & Culture department in Brooklyn, NY

Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes, communities, and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry.

To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers, reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow, both ourselves and our business.

Job Purpose  
To execute recruitment strategies and full lifecycle recruitment process to hire top talent for the organization through sourcing and assessing applicants.

Experience Required

* Strong communication, relationship building and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to adapt approach and consider what is important to the audience by tailoring message accordingly to source talent and promote the brand.
* Proven skills in sourcing candidates using a variety of methods, e.g. database searches, internet job postings, campus recruitment, cold calling, candidate referrals and networking.

Key Accountabilities

* Develop, execute and drive the implementation of talent acquisition plans and strategies, assuring a qualified, diverse pool of candidates to fill open positions as well as talent gaps identified through the succession planning process.
* Attract, develop and maintain a “ready now” candidate pool through such means as continuous review of resumes, cold calling recommended external candidates, and career fairs.

- This position will also mainly cover facilitation of candidate background checks and drug screen process and completing necessary paperwork.  
- This position will be assisting various recruiters across NY and MA.  
- This job will also be involved in working directly with candidates and hiring managers.  
- Provide follow-up correspondence to candidates on recruitment status. Update candidate records and job postings in applicant tracking system.  
- Facilitate new hire on-boarding paperwork.  
- Potential to conduct candidate phone screens and make job offers.  
- Other tasks and projects, as assigned and needed.

* Screen candidates to ascertain fit to available position using behavioral and competency-based interview methodologies.
* Understand vision, business model, employee value proposition, benefits, and total rewards philosophy to engage candidates.
* Drive results utilizing metrics (i.e., time to fill, testing, retention) to assess performance of recruitment strategies in a fast paced and high volume environment.
* Design an efficient network and provide required training and perform various talent retention activities.
* Assist with the development and implementation of innovative, cost effective and consistent strategic workforce plans to meet the staffing requirements of the business functions via internal and external applicants.

Qualifications

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required
* Minimum of 1 year recruitment experience required with a track record of success in a high volume, fast paced corporate environment within HR
* Knowledge of applicant tracking systems, OFCCP, federal, state and local laws and regulations capability requirements
* Capable of analyzing collective bargaining agreements to ensure recruitment practices align with intent, spirit and terms of contract
* Proficiency in data analytics and Excel
* Must have knowledge and experience working with represented workforce (Collective Bargaining Agreement) employees

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $40.00 - $50.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

title: HR Associate
description:
About NYC Health + Hospitals/Harlem

**Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible**

Harlem Hospital Center has been a bedrock of the Harlem community since 1887. The hospital provides a wide range of medical, surgical, diagnostic, therapeutic and family support services to the residents of Central Harlem, West Harlem, Washington Heights and Inwood. Harlem is the largest hospital in the area, capable of treating the most seriously ill. Harlem provides over 90 specialized ambulatory care services, dentistry and oral surgery, behavioral health services, and community substance abuse treatment.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

**Job Description**

The Business Partner is responsible for supporting and coordinating matters to support the business unit related to employee training, engagement, staffing and compliance. This role involves ensuring compliance with Regulatory standards, company policies and regulations. This position supports the organization's goals by assisting in planning, development and implementation of human resources policies, programs and practices.

* Collaborate with department directors & managers to identify departmental needs through regular (weekly) meetings with respective business units.
* Training /Compliance Oversight: Collaborate with the compliance team to facilitate training sessions using a variety of methods, such as presentations, workshops, and online modules,
* ensuring content is engaging and effectively delivered to employees at all levels.
* Guides business unit on employee relations / counseling for supervisors and employees regarding personnel matters, job difficulties and development opportunities. Consult with the labor department as needed/required.
* Analyzes trends and metrics in partnership with the HR group to develop solutions, programs and policies
* Participate in the Environment of Care meetings and monitors the data.
* Documentation and Record-Keeping: Maintain accurate records of training activities, compliance audits, and employee certification requirements, collaboration with unit director and HR compliance team to ensure documentation is current and accessible for internal and external audits.
* Employee Engagement: Collaborates with business unit to promote a culture of continuous staff engagement and training development by encouraging employee participation in training initiatives and providing support and resources.
* Escalation: Effective communication and escalation of challenges as identified
* Effective and timely communication and escalation to HRD as needed
* Additional Responsibilities including regulatory survey participation, emergency management, staff engagement.
* Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local regulations via regular internal audits and data management.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications

1. Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university in Human Resources Management, Labor Relations, Public Relations, Healthcare Administration, or a related discipline; or  
2. Associate’s Degree from an accredited college or university in Human Resources Management, Labor Relations, Public Relations, Healthcare Administration, or a related discipline and two (2) years of relevant experience in human resources or personnel administration, labor relations, employee relations, learning and development, talent acquisition, customer service (providing information and resolving customer concerns), or a related administrative support function; or  
3. High School Diploma or its educational equivalent and four (4) years of relevant experience, as described in “2” above.

**How To Apply**

If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

*Also, please apply to our job posting on the NYC Health and Hospitals careers pages at careers.nychhc.org and search for JOB ID # 107006*

NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

* Employee discount

title: Program Coordinator
description:
**Job description**

**Position Title:** Program Coordinator

**Department:** Programs

**FLSA Status:** Exempt

**Reports to:** Chief Operating Officer

**POSITION SUMMARY:**

This position is responsible for the oversight of all program management and development for the Agency, including the Pre-Vocational Program, Saturday Program, After School Program, Culinary Program, Supported Employment services and Residential programs once established.

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:**

**Program Management**

· Responsible for the overall leadership, oversight, and management of the Agency’s operational programs and any other services as directed.

· Work collectively as part of the Agency’s Leadership Team as well as with individuals at all levels within the Agency.

· Ensures ongoing regulatory compliance of all programs.

· Maintain standards of program development and service delivery consistent with the Agency mission, philosophy, and program policies and procedures.

· Ensure on-going oversight and assessment of programmatic needs, individual consumer needs, proper utilization management, and both client and staff satisfaction.

· Oversee the coordination of admissions, inter-program movement, and discharge of clients as appropriate. Participate in admission meetings, treatment planning and discharge conferences as indicated.

· Directly supervise the Pre-Vocational, Saturday and After-School Programs.

· Ensure that all programs are adequately staffed, and that staff are provided with appropriate orientation and training.

· Ensure the highest level of quality in all program/service environments.

· Actively participate as a member of various Agency committees, leading the Parent Advocacy Group and Leaders Committee (Human Rights) as well attending Incident Review and Corporate Compliance committees as requested.

· Collaborates with the Human Resources and Compliance Directors on staff training and regulatory compliance issues.

· Works closely with the Chief Operating Officer in developing policies and procedures for all service programs.

· Assist clients who need help in the DDD application process as needed.

· Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:**

· Minimum of 5-7 years of experience managing programs for individuals with developmental disabilities required.

· Experience with DDD and/or OPWDD compliance issues, as well as the processes and procedures that the Agency is mandated to follow.

· Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Social Work, Vocational Rehabilitation, Social Services, or a related field preferred.

· Strong interpersonal and communication skills both verbal and written, team oriented and the ability to develop positive and professional relationships.

· Authorized to work in the U.S.
