title: 2024 Part-Time Arena Services Staff
description:
**Company Description**  

The New York Red Bulls Operations Department are looking for motivated and hardworking individuals to join to our Arena Services staff. The season(s) will get under way in late February and carry on through until the end of the calendar year. This role is a unique opportunity to join the club and gain comprehensive understanding of operations at NYRB and Red Bull Arena (RBA). Experience will also include working match days for reigning NWSL Champions NJ/NY Gotham FC. In addition to soccer events (MLS, MLSNP, NWSL), chosen applicants will likely be exposed to dark day assignments, special events, stadium projects, and potential requested support at the first team training ground.


This position will serve as the first face and experience that fans will encounter at Red Bull Arena. Candidates who will excel in this role must be ready to make a positive first impression, treat people with a professional level of hospitality expected at RBA, and be knowledgeable to answer questions from our guests.

 ***Due to the cyclical nature of the entertainment industry, the employee may be required to work varying schedules to reflect the business needs of the company.***

 **Job Description** **RESPONSIBILITIES**

  

* New York Red Bulls (MLS) Matches @ RBA, NJ/NY Gotham FC (NWSL) Matches @ RBA, International Matches @ RBA.
* Support operations of RBA, as well as stadium setup, breakdown, staging and conversion for matches.
* Coordinate with other Red Bull New York departments to ensure successful event planning and execution.
* Liaise with outside parties (visiting teams, referees, league officials, vendors, partners, etc.) to ensure all needs are met.
* Other designated assigned duties.

  

**Qualifications**  

Students pursuing career in Sports Management/Event Operations and/or 1-2 years of related experience.


An individual with the ability to lift 50+ pounds and perform moderate labor over the course of a full event (8-12 hrs). Must be able to work outdoors in varying weather conditions (heat, cold, rain, etc.).


Experience showing professionalism around pro athletes/teams, while maintaining composure and effectiveness under pressure and changing conditions in a team environment.


Ability to meet deadlines; accomplish work in order of priority; effectively multitask and deliver consistently at a high level.

 **Additional Information**  

Red Bull New York is an equal opportunity employer and we will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or any other classification protected by law.

title: Business Development Manager - Outside Sales / International Logistics
description:
**Company Description**  

At MGF, we are a leader in providing innovation logistics solutions to our clients. With a strong focus on customer satisfaction and commitment to service, we are dedicated to delivering reliable, flexible and cost-effective import, export and domestic transportation services. As a Business Development Manager, you will play a pivotal role in expanding our client base, driving sales and contributing to the overall success of our organization.


Our NJ operation encompasses the following business units; customs brokerage, freight forwarding, warehousing and distribution. With clients across various industries from oil and gas, mining and forestry to food beverage and agriculture; machinery, construction, paper and packaging to retail commodities - MGF has a diverse service portfolio, and a customer base to match.

 **Job Description**  

Are you a skilled sales professional with a passion for driving business growth? A true hunter, outside sales person, looking for an exciting opportunity to join a leading North American logistics company with aggressive growth plans in the USA? If so, Manitoulin Global Forwarding (MGF) invites you to apply as a Business Development Manager with our Harrison, NJ operation!

**Key Responsibilities**

* Identify and engage with potential clients within the logistics industry, including manufacturers, distributors and retailers.
* Utilize your strong entrepreneurial skills to proactively identify new business opportunities and foster a culture of innovation.
* Develop and implement a comprehensive business development strategy to drive pipeline growth and achieve sales targets.
* Cultivate new and existing leads from within the MGF Group and our various international partners.
* Conduct thorough market research to identify industry trends, competitive landscape and potential business opportunities.
* Conduct sales presentations, negotiations and proposals to potential clients, addressing their specific needs and showcasing the benefits of our services.
* Collaborate closely with the operations team to ensure seamless on boarding of new clients and maintain high level customer satisfaction.
* Stay up to date on industry developments, market trends and emerging technologies to identify new business opportunities.

 **Qualifications** **Requirements**

* 5-10 years experience in business development or sales in the international logistics and transportation industry.
* Proven track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets, with a focus on driving new business.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex information and supply chain solutions to clients.
* Strong interpersonal skills, a natural relationship builder with the ability to establish rapport and trust with clients and colleagues alike.
* A strategic thinker with with a deep understanding of the air and ocean logistics industry, market dynamics and customer needs.
* Proficiency in CRM software and other sales tools to manage and track pipeline activity.
* Strong entrepreneurial skills with the ability to identify and capitalize on new business opportunities.
* Bilingual proficiency in English and Spanish is an asset.

**Advantages (Preferred, but not required):**

* Strong knowledge of US Customs rules and regulations would be very advantageous to compliment

  

**Additional Information** **Why Join MGF ?**

* A high visibility position in a new expansion where you have the opportunity to make a real and visible impact on the success and growth of the business.
* Opportunity to work with a diverse and talented team of professionals in a collaborative and supportive environment.
* Competitive salary package, including base salary and incentives and benefits. Especially for applicants with an existing book of business/client base who could have immediate impact.
* Opportunity for further professional growth and development within our fast growing organization.


To apply for this exciting opportunity, please submit your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and achievements in business development.

title: Field Clerk
description:
**Company Description**  

Safeway is a forward-thinking **utility construction contractor** with over 20 years of history, and a focus on better processes to deliver quality, safety, and compliance for our customers. We have local roots with global reach as part of Vinci SA, a $43 billion publicly-traded company, making us a different kind of NYC-area utility contractor. We tackle our customer’s most complex and challenging projects and deliver them flawlessly and safely. Even underneath the congested streets of New York City and Long Island—under intense time constraints—we build high-quality utility (electric, gas, and telecom) infrastructure **that will last for generations**.

 **Job Description**  

Safeway was recently awarded a contract with PSEG Long Island to build a new 2-mile underground electric transmission cable in the Rockaways section of Queens (Arverne to Far Rockaway).


We are looking for a Field Clerk to support this project from December 2021 through approximately June 2022. The position reports to the project's Field Superintendent and will work out of the temporary construction trailer near the jobsite (Arverne). Base work hours are 6:30 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. Monday through Friday, and occasional overtime may be required.


This person will interface between the construction office and the field to ensure good daily job planning, documentation, report submittals, NYC DOT permit tracking/renewal, job package preparation/tracking, printing, scanning, answering phones, and processing/responding to emails.


$20 - $23/hr depending on qualifications.


Job Duties:

* Print and assemble job drawings, permits, and other documentation into job folders to issue to field crews in the morning
* Answer phone calls/emails/txt from crews, Field Superintendents, and customers to expedite and resolve emergent issues
* Collect, inventory, scan, and submit completed job paperwork (save in Sharepoint document storage system)
* Track and check that all paperwork is being completed timely each day, and flag problems for the Superintendents to address with the crews
* Track and renew NYDOT permits, in coordination with our customers, and track/resolve any associated violations
* Assemble and compile weekly reports for weekly meeting with customer (notes, photos, etc all in one report document)
* Collect, scan, and submit daily timesheets from the field after approvals
* Other duties as needed to support the contract

  

**Qualifications**  

Desired Qualifications:

* 18+ years old
* No minimum education requirement
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Organized, meticulous, and detail-oriented
* Driven with exceptional work ethic (on time every day)
* Ability to remain calm and focused under pressure with regular distractions
* Proficient with Microsoft Outlook (email), Word, and PowerPoint
* Good working knowledge of Microsoft 365 Suite, including Sharepoint document storage
* Comfortable helping field employees with basic IT troubleshooting (resetting phone/tablet passwords, navigating cloud storage systems, etc)
* Good mechanical aptitude (able to tinker with and repair small tools)

  

**Additional Information**  

Veterans encouraged to apply!


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
